definition: to compete/to take part (in a sports event)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel

sentences.english: Participant(s) who fail to produce valid identity documents will not be permitted to participate in the race.
sentences.chinese: 未能出示有效身份证明文件的参赛者，不得出赛。

sentences.english: His performances, once acclimatized to the Premiership, have earned him rave reviews.
sentences.chinese: 他在超级联赛的出赛表现为他赢得了舆论的尊重。

sentences.english: Oh, lemon , mama is run horse.
Well, now I'll pass on the tradition to the athletes that are competing next year.
sentences.chinese: 好，现在我要把传统传承给明年出赛的运动员。

sentences.english: Woods was scheduled to start the tournament with a new caddie Byron Bell.
sentences.chinese: 伍兹预计要和新杆弟拜伦贝尔一同出赛。

sentences.english: In any Womens race, all team members should be females except the Steersman .
sentences.chinese: 女子组比赛除舵手外全部由女性出赛。

sentences.english: Thank you for covering my games in the United Sates .
sentences.chinese: 感谢你们对我在美国出赛的报导。

definition: to compete/to take part in a competition
on stage/to go on stage/to take the field
(of a performer) to come onto the stage to perform/(of an athlete) to enter the arena to compete/(fig.) to enter the scene (e.g. a new product)/(of an examinee etc) to leave the venue
absence/absent
competition (sports etc)/match/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]/to compete
to compete/competition/match/to surpass/better than/superior to/to excel
competition (e.g. sporting)
poised for battle/to square up for a fight
to go on stage/fig. to appear on the scene/used in advertising to mean new product
to go into battle/to campaign (military)
to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
preliminary competition/to hold preliminary heats
exhibition game
to replace
campaign/expedition
to come back out of retirement/to get involved again after having withdrawn
